official-title.#text: To approve the Keystone XL Pipeline.

attestation-date.#text: Passed the House of Representatives November 14, 2014.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: (including any subsequent revision to the pipeline route within the State of Nebraska required or authorized by the State of Nebraska).

text.#text: TransCanada Keystone Pipeline, L.P. may construct, connect, operate, and maintain the pipeline and cross-border facilities described in the application filed on May 4, 2012, by TransCanada Corporation to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: in January 2014, regarding the pipeline referred to in subsection (a), and the environmental analysis, consultation, and review described in that document (including appendices) shall be considered to fully satisfy—

text.#text: The Final Supplemental Environmental Impact Statement issued by the
any other provision of law that requires Federal agency consultation or review (including the consultation or review required under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: ) with respect to the pipeline and facilities referred to in subsection (a).

text.#text: Any Federal permit or authorization issued before the date of enactment of this Act for the pipeline and cross-border facilities referred to in subsection (a) shall remain in effect.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: United States Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia Circuit

text.#text: Any legal challenge to a Federal agency action regarding the pipeline and cross-border facilities described in subsection (a), and the related facilities in the United States, that are approved by this Act, and any permit, right-of-way, or other action taken to construct or complete the project pursuant to Federal law, shall only be subject to judicial review on direct appeal to the

Nothing in this Act alters any Federal, State, or local process or condition in effect on the date of enactment of this Act that is necessary to secure access from an owner of private property to construct the pipeline and cross-border facilities described in subsection (a).

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HR 5682 EH: To approve the Keystone XL Pipeline.
